cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 210 mi (340 km) SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest across the Yucatán tonight, accelerate northward into the Gulf of Mexico Tuesday, then turn north-northeast and sweep across the northern Gulf Coast Wednesday before racing across the Southeast toward the Mid-Atlantic late Thursday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches/warnings limited to the Yucatán Peninsula and Gulf Coast—none issued north of Louisiana yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Tulum to Dzilam, Mexico; Tropical-Storm Warning: portions of western Cuba and northern Yucatán coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact zone from Yucatán Peninsula, across northern Gulf Coast (LA-MS-AL) and inland across GA, TN Valley, southern Appalachians, eventually Mid-Atlantic including coastal Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible (20–35 mph gusts) late Thu as remnants pass inland to the west
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Virginia coast with current forecast track
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 in common, isolated 4–6 in possible Thursday–Friday leading to flash-flooding concerns
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief periods of reduced visibility and harbor swell could disrupt cargo handling and vessel scheduling late Thu–early Fri
